ids_info.name: cryostat
ids_info.description: Description of the cryostat surrounding the machine (if any)

cryostat/description_2d.documentation: Set of 2D cryostat descriptions, for each type of possible physics or engineering configurations necessary. Within cryostat IDS: Description of the cryostat surrounding the machine (if any).

cryostat/description_2d/cryostat.documentation: Mechanical structure of the cryostat. It is described as a set of nested layers with given physics properties; Two representations are admitted for each vessel unit : annular (two contours) or block elements. Within cryostat IDS: Description of the cryostat surrounding the machine (if any). Within description_2d container: Set of 2D cryostat descriptions, for each type of possible physics or engineering configurations necessary.

cryostat/description_2d/cryostat/type.documentation: Type of the description. index = 0 for the official single/multiple annular representation and 1 for the official block element representation for each unit. Additional representations needed on a code-by-code basis follow same incremental pair tagging starting on index=2. Within cryostat IDS: Description of the cryostat surrounding the machine (if any). Within description_2d container: Set of 2D cryostat descriptions, for each type of possible physics or engineering configurations necessary. Within cryostat container: Mechanical structure of the cryostat. It is described as a set of nested layers with given physics properties; Two representations are admitted for each vessel unit : annular (two contours) or block elements.

Within cryostat container: Mechanical structure of the cryostat. It is described as a set of nested layers with given physics properties; Two representations are admitted for each vessel unit : annular (two contours) or block elements. Within type container: Type of the description. index = 0 for the official single/multiple annular representation and 1 for the official block element representation for each unit. Additional representations needed on a code-by-code basis follow same incremental pair tagging starting on index=2.

Thickness of the vessel layer  in the perpendicular direction to the centreline. Thickness(i) is the thickness of the layer between centreline/r(i),z(i) and centreline/r(i+1),z(i+1), so its size is equal to the length of centreline/r-1 if the thickness is varying. If the thickness is constant for all points, allocate this node to size 1 to store a single value. Within cryostat IDS: Description of the cryostat surrounding the machine (if any).
